It is native to southern Africa, particularly South Africa, where it grows in grassland and rocky habitats. The plant is characterized by its erect, herbaceous stems and small, clustered flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. Its leaves are ovate to elliptic in shape and have a hairy texture. Calopsis incurvata is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its delicate appearance and ability to thrive in well-drained soils.
